meanings.definition: A particular form or version of a published text.
meanings.sent1: I bought the latest editions of my favorite books.
meanings.sent2: The bookstore had multiple editions of the same novel.
meanings.sent3: It was funny how the different editions of the magazine had unique covers.
meanings.sent4: Her wardrobe was like different editions of a fashion magazine, each with its own style.
meanings.sent5: The library displayed rare editions of classic novels.

meanings.definition: The total number of copies of a book, newspaper, or other publication printed at one time.
meanings.sent1: The bookstore sold out of all its editions of the new bestseller.
meanings.sent2: The newspaper printed thousands of editions for the morning rush.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see so many editions of the same comic book stacked up.
meanings.sent4: The field of flowers looked like countless editions of a colorful magazine cover.
meanings.sent5: The bakery produced limited editions of its special pastries.

meanings.definition: The process of preparing a text for publication.
meanings.sent1: Editing is a crucial step in creating quality editions of books.
meanings.sent2: The author spent months on the final editions of the manuscript.
meanings.sent3: The editions of the cookbook were meticulously crafted with love.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a whirlwind of ideas during the editing editions of her novel.
meanings.sent5: The team worked tirelessly on the last editions of the magazine layout.
